comments:
Steps to reproduce:

Install a fresh PDE build of JSF into a fresh Eclipse/WTP instance (unzip feature.zip method of install).  Then:

1) With a blank, never used workspace, open the Project Wizard for Dynamic Web Projects.

2) On the first page select "JavaServer Faces v1.1 Project" in the "Configurations" download.  Fill in the project name.

3) Under "Project Facets" change nothing, click Next.

4) Click next to the Web Module page.  Note that there is no option to click Next to configure the JSF libraries.

5) Click Finish.

I get an error dialog saying there was a problem creating the JSF part of the project.  After accepting the dialog, the project is created, but not properly initialized.  For example, no faces-config.xml is created.

The following stack traces appear in the log:

java.lang.NullPointerException

Problem seen with build from head June 8.
WTP version wtp-sdk-I-I200606061811
Eclipse M7
EMF 2.2.0RC6a
GEF 3.2RC4
JEM 1.2RC2

Fixed.  

This path probably not called before and is now called due to the fix for 145166. 
But, the cause for the NPE is fixed.
Just noticed that the one I opened on June 23 is a duplicate of this exact bug.  Problem was still reproducing.
Downgrading to normal severity because we have successfully characterized a workaround: name the project in the dialog before selecting the configuration from the dropdown.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 148498 ***

traces.message: Path for project must have only one segment.
